abstract.text: The kinds of assignable content a context can contain.

inlineContent.text: When you initialize a new context with

to provide an indication of how your content is structured. The type doesn’t affect the context’s behavior, but it does provide an important indicator to teachers trying to understand your app’s content.

abstract.text: Enable teachers to assign activities from your app’s content and to view student progress.
An optional name that the system presents to the user if you choose the custom context type.
Updates the kind of content that a context represents.
The kind of content a context represents.
The kinds of assignable content a context can contain.
A context that represents an entire course.
A context for assignable content that isn’t represented by one of the built-in context types.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
